RITES Ltd. last week was declared as the lowest bidder to prepare a Detailed Project Report (DPR) for a new metro corridor connecting Koyambedu and Avadi in north-west Chennai. This roughly 16.07 km elevated metro line will pass through Thirumangalam, Mugappair and Ambattur. It is planned to be built as a spur of Chennai Metro‚Äôs Line-5 (Madhavaram ‚Äì Sholinganallur) which is currently under construction as part of the 116.1 km Chennai Metro Phase 2 project. The line‚Äôs detailed feasibility report, finalized by L&T Infrastructure Engineering in mid-2023, estimates its construction with 15 tentative elevated stations to cost Rs. 6376.18 crore. CMRL in February 2024 invited bids for the line‚Äôs DPR consultant contract with a 180 day deadline and an unknown estimate. Technical bids were opened in April 2024 to reveal 6 bidders. During evaluation, AECOM India ‚Äì URS Scott Wilson India JV‚Äôs bid was found non-compliant to the tender‚Äôs conditions and was disqualified. Tunnels often involve complex underground operations, heavy machinery, and intricate engineering processes, making the potential risks significant.
